metadata.Title: CVE-2021-38495 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers reported memory safety bugs present in Thunderbird 78.13.0. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.1 and Firefox ESR < 91.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-38495` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.1.2+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.1.2+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.1.2+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.1.2+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.1.2+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.1.2+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:91.1.2+build1-0ubuntu1').
